org.catechis
Class Domartin

java.lang.Object
  org.catechis.Domartin

public class Domartin
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains general purpose static methods for all commoners.

The name reflects the Commons of Domartin in Switzerland when the Authors ancestors live.

To Do:

Create an exception for getFileExtension in the case that there is no extension.

@author Timothy Butler Curchod

@version Setpember 11, 2004

createFileFromUserNPath

public static java.io.File createFileFromUserNPath(java.lang.String user,
                                                   java.lang.String path)
Parameters:
user - Name/id of the user which equates to a folder in the 'files' directory.
path - Path that is added to the name from which the file is create.
Returns:
A file that is created by adding the path to the user separeted by the system separator.

incrementWordLevel

public static java.lang.String incrementWordLevel(java.lang.String current_level)

Here we check for tests from only the given test file passed in as an argument.

We return only the pass/fail string of the most recent test.

private static String mostRecentTestResult(Iterator all_tests, String test_name) { String most_recent_result = new String(); DateFormat df = DateFormat.getDateInstance(); Date recent_date = null; while (all_tests.hasNext()) { Element test = (Element)all_tests.next(); String file_name = test.getChildText("file"); if (file_name.equals(test_name)) { // find most recent test date. } } return most_recent_result; }

getTestType

public static java.lang.String getTestType(java.lang.String test_file)
Here we parse the test type. Original tests were like this: basic_writing.test They included level 1 to 3 or something. Therefore we cant use them to establish R.O.F. After that the looked like: level 0 reading.test

Old tests looked like this:

basic_writing.test

for levels 0 to 1?

or this:

intermediate_writing.test

for tests 1 to 2?

and even:

beginner_reading.test

same as basic???

I had to construct them based on the order of the tests, to see at what level they changed.

And were chenged around Dec 15th, 2005 during the end of the hey days with Bommie the beautiful.

checkOldUser

public static java.lang.String checkOldUser(java.lang.String user_name,
                                            java.lang.String user_id,
                                            java.lang.String context_path)
If the folder is named after the user_id, then the user_name needs to be set as the id, as the user_name used to be used as the id.

Returns the users name if there is a folder under the users name.

Returns the users id if there is no folder under their name, cause its named after their id.
